curated_text: Symbol: ABBV. Year: 2024. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the California Business and Professions Code, AndroGel, King Drug Co., Florence, Inc., Solvay Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Abbott, sham litigation, the State of, Oregon Circuit Court, MDL, National Prescription Opiate Litigation, the United States Tax Court, AbbVie Inc., Subsidiaries, the Internal Revenue Service, Shareholder and Securities Litigation, Holwill, Humira, Treppel Family Trust, the Food and Drug Administration’s, Camargo, Allergan Inc., the U.S. Patent Office, Biocell®, Allergan Biocell Textured Breast Implant Product Liability Litigation, Intellectual Property Litigation AbbVie Inc., Reddy’s Laboratories, Ltd., Reddy’s Laboratories, Genentech, Inc., Venclexta, Rinvoq, Hetero USA, Inc., Hetero Labs Limited Unit-V, Aurobindo Pharma Ltd., Sandoz, Sandoz Private Limited, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, Ltd., Aurobindo Pharma U.S.A., Aurobindo Pharma Limited, Zydus Pharmaceuticals, Zydus Lifesciences Limited, MSN Pharmaceuticals Inc., MSN Laboratories Private Limited, MSN Life Sciences Private Limited, Hetero USA Inc., Hetero Labs Limited Unit-III, Merck Sharp & Dohme, CODM, 819, 888 Total, Vraylar United States, Eye Care Ozurdex, Lumigan/Ganfort United States, 288, 590 Total, Linzess/Constella United, ImmunoGen, ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION, the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, Supplementary Data, Cerevel Therapeutics Holdings, Inc., Cerevel Therapeutics, Consolidated Financial Statements, ImmunoGen, Inc., Research and Development Research, GCA, Phase 3b/4 Level-Up, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, FDA, PsA, TNF, European Medicines Agency, EMA, the European Commission, EC, HS, HS Clinical Response, Accelerated Approval, the EMA Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use, FRα)-positive, Phase 2, PICCOLO, Navitoclax •, a Biologics License Application, Teliso-V, NSCLC, Botox Cosmetic •, Botox Cosmetic, Neuroscience Vyalev •, the European Union, Complete Response Letter, CRL, the New Drug Application, NDA, Vyalev, Percent, United States, Imbruvica, Juvederm Collection, Botox Therapeutic, Vraylar, Ubrelvy, SG&A, Research and Development, Upfront, Celsius Therapeutics, Non-Operating Expenses (Income, Company, LIQUIDITY, Credit Risk AbbVie. Context excerpt: competition provision of the California Business and Professions Code seeking injunctive relief, restitution, civil penalties and attorneys’ fees. In August 2019, direct purchasers of AndroGel filed a lawsuit, King Drug Co. of Florence, Inc., et al. v. AbbVie Inc., et al., against AbbVie and others in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania, alleging that 2006 patent litigation settlements and related agreements by Solvay Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (a company Abbott acquired in February 2010 and now known as AbbVie Products LLC) with three generic companies violated federal antitrust law, and also alleging that 2011 patent litigation by Abbott with two generic companies regarding AndroGel was sham litigation and the settlements of those litigations violated federal antitrust law. In September 2024, AbbVie and plaintiffs reached an agreement to resolve this lawsuit. In November 2022, the State of Oregon filed a lawsuit in the Multnomah County, Oregon Circuit
